title: Assur Archive 39
description: In a room northeast of the courtyard of a private house (in bE8I), excavators found an archive of 29 clay tablets. Two more texts may also belong here. Most of the texts date to the 7th century BC. The archive concerns individuals named Nabu-šar-ahhešu, Sagib-Aššur, and others. It includes both purchase documents and loans.

properties.description: Representative locations of the Neo-Assyrian archive at Assur on the basis of Pedersén 1987 Plan(s) 62.
properties.title: Plan location of Assur Archive 39
